thread.title: La Salle tops Moeller, 13-7, in OT thriller
thread.title_full: La Salle tops Moeller, 13-7, in OT thriller

title: La Salle tops Moeller, 13-7, in OT thriller
text:
La Salle tops Moeller, 13-7, in OT thriller Tom Ramstetter, Enquirer contributor 10:38 p.m. EDT October 2, 2015 Buy Photo La Salle quarterback Nick Watson (17) makes a run to the outside during the second quarter of the OHSAA football game between the Moeller Crusaders and the La Salle Lancers at Lockland Stadium in Cincinnati on Friday, Oct. 2, 2015. At the half, the Crusaders led 7-0. (Photo: The Enquirer/Sam Greene) Buy Photo 
Hayden Jester got the present he was hoping for on his 18th birthday Friday night at Roettger Stadium when the La Salle football team rallied to beat Moeller 13-7 in overtime in a Greater Catholic League South slugfest in Lockland. 
And Jester helped deliver the win with a fourth-down stop inside the La Salle 1 on Moeller’s overtime-opening possession. Two plays later, senior quarterback Nick Watson scored the game winner from 19 yards out. 
“Just what I wanted for my birthday,” Jester said. “That was pretty awesome.” 
It was the first time in program history that La Salle beat Moeller a second straight year after beating the Crusaders 34-9 last Oct. 3 at La Salle. The Crusaders have a 48-7 record in the all-time series. 
La Salle schedule, stats 
Jester, a senior linebacker, blew through the Crusaders offensive line and stymied Moeller junior running back Hunter Hughes just before the goal line on a run around the left side to set up Watson. 
“It was just amazing,” Jester said. “I saw the one guy just open up and I went right through. That was the coaches. The coaches had a great play call. I just made the play. It could have been anybody in there.” 
Watson’s run came on second down on La Salle’s overtime possession. The quarterback bounced of a couple tacklers on a keeper and sprinted to the left corner of the end zone to end the game.
